name: Paneer Rice
history: Paneer Rice, a popular Indian dish, combines the rich taste of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) with aromatic basmati rice and spices. It's a fusion of traditional Indian flavors, often enjoyed as a main course in various regions of India.
description: Paneer Rice is a delicious and aromatic dish made by cooking basmati rice with paneer cubes, spices, and herbs. It's a flavorful and satisfying meal, often garnished with fresh coriander or mint and served with raita or curry.

equipment.name: pan
equipment.description: For cooking the rice and paneer.

ingredients.item: fresh coriander or mint leaves, chopped

instructions.title: Prepare the Rice
instructions.description: Wash the basmati rice until water runs clear, then soak for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.

instructions.title: Cook the Paneer
instructions.description: Heat oil or ghee in a pan. Add paneer cubes and fry until golden brown. Remove and set aside.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Spices and Vegetables
instructions.description: In the same pan, add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add onions and ginger-garlic paste. SautÃ© until onions are translucent. Add turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and green peas. Cook for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Cook the Rice
instructions.description: Add the drained rice to the pan. SautÃ© for 2-3 minutes. Add water and salt, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and cook until rice is done.

instructions.title: Combine with Paneer
instructions.description: Once the rice is cooked, gently fluff it with a fork and mix in the fried paneer cubes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander or mint leaves. Serve the Paneer Rice hot, accompanied by raita or curry.

tips: Ensure the rice is not overcooked to maintain texture.
Marinate the paneer in spices for extra flavor before frying.
variations: Add vegetables like carrots or bell peppers for added nutrition.
Use brown rice instead of basmati for a healthier version.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on the stove until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative serving dish with a side of pickles or salad.
Garnish with fried cashews or almonds for added crunch.
